View_Controllers

Class MultiController

  • java.lang.Object
    • View_Controllers.MultiController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddAppointmentController, AddCustomerController, AppointmentsController, ContactReportController, CustomersController, LocationReportController, LoginController, ModifyAppointmentController, ModifyCustomerController, TypeMonthReportController

    public abstract class MultiController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Contains variables and methods used by all other Controllers

      • loadAppointments

        protected void loadAppointments(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Loads the Appointments screen. Sends fxml file address and an instance of the MultiController class to the loadScreen() function.
        Parameters:
        event - mouse input when the user clicks the Log In button or Appointments button

      • popAppointmentOptions

        protected void popAppointmentOptions()
        Prefills the available options in the ComboBoxes on the Add Appointment and Modify Appointment screens

        Lambda Expression: Improves the code by avoiding repetition of the verbose syntax for converting an hour from an integer to a LocalTime

      • popCustomerOptions

        protected void popCustomerOptions()
        Prefills the available options in the ComboBoxes on the Add Customer and Modify Customer screens

        Parameters:

      • updateCountry

      • saveAppointment

        protected void saveAppointment(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Checks user input for the Add Appointment or Modify Appointment screen fields. Will display error if any of the fields are empty. If selected date and time are already past, already exist, or are outside of business hours (8am-10pm EST), then calls DBQuery to save the input data to the db

        Lambda Expression (Line 344): Reduces code repetition and allows the syntax required for converting date/time fields to Instant values to be written once

        Parameters:
        event - mouse input when the user clicks the Save button

      • saveCustomer

        protected void saveCustomer(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Checks user input for Add Customer or Modify Customer screen fields. Displays error if any of the fields are empty and calls DBQuery to save the input to the db.
        Parameters:
        event - mouse input when the user clicks the Save button

      • confirmationWindow

        protected boolean confirmationWindow(java.lang.String id)
        Displays confirmation window before deleting item
        Parameters:
        id - of the custom/appointment being deleted
        Returns:
        boolean value of true if the user wants to proceed and false if not

      • clearError

        protected void clearError(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Clears any error messages
        Parameters:
        event - mouse input when the user clicks away from the item that caused the message
